info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 04 at 12:57PM MDT until June 04 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Cerro Pelado burn scar in... East Central Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... * Until 400 PM MDT. * At 1257 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Between 0.25 and 0.50 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in one half hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.50 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. * Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Canada Camada, Peralta Canyon, Bland Canyon, Tent Rocks National Monument, Cochiti Pueblo, and Cochiti Golf Club. Debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 0.5 HOURS
info.instruction: Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages. This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks, streams and ditches in the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters, climb to safety.
